intro: Labourdonnaisia hexandra, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in umbels. It is known for its milky sap, which can be toxic if ingested. Labourdonnaisia hexandra is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine in some African countries.
